Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.name: pickerFieldShouldBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should begin in the specified PickerField.

Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.name: pickerFieldDidEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.abstract: Tells the delegate editing ended in the specified PickerField.

Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.name: pickerFieldCleared(_:)
Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that the contents have been cleared in the specified PickerField.

Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.name: pickerField(_:didSelectRow:)
Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that a row was selected in the specified PickerField.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldShouldBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should begin in the specified EntryField.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldDidBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Tells the delegate that editing began in the specified EntryField.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldShouldEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should stop in the specified EntryField.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldDidEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Tells the delegate that editing stopped for the specified EntryField.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldShouldReturn(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Asks the delegate if the EntryField should process the pressing of the return button.

Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.name: entryFieldShouldClear(_:)
Protocols/EntryFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@.abstract: Asks the delegate if the EntryFieldâ€™s current contents should be removed.

Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: dateFieldShouldBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should begin in the specified DateField.

Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: dateFieldDidEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Tells the delegate editing ended in the specified DateField.

Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: dateFieldCleared(_:)
Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that the contents have been cleared in the specified DateField.

Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: dateChanged(_:)
Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that a row was selected in the specified DateField.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: areaFieldShouldBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should begin in the specified AreaField.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: areaFieldDidBeginEditing(_:)
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that editing of the specified EntryField has begun.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: areaFieldShouldEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Asks the delegate if editing should stop in the specified EntryField.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: areaFieldDidEndEditing(_:)
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Tells the delegate that editing of the specified EntryField has ended.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.name: areaField(_:shouldChangeTextIn:replacementText:)
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html#/c:@M@M.abstract: Asks the delegate whether the specified text should be replaced in the EntryField.

Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html.name: AreaFieldDelegate
Protocols/AreaFieldDelegate.html.abstract: EntryFieldDelegate protocol. Forwards all UITextView delegate methods.

Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html.name: DateFieldDelegate
Protocols/DateFieldDelegate.html.abstract: PickerFieldDelegate protocol. Forwards editing state changes and content changes.

Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html.name: PickerFieldDelegate
Protocols/PickerFieldDelegate.html.abstract: PickerFieldDelegate protocol. Forwards editing state changes and content changes.

Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.name: isClearable
Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.abstract: Setter for showing a clear button to eliminate the contents of the field.

Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.name: isManualEntryCapable
Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.abstract: Specifies if the PickerField supports manual entry which will show up as the last option in the picker.

Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.name: setIndexTo
Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.abstract: Changes index in PickerField. If value is below the lower bound (0), it defualts to 0. If the value is over the upper bound, it defaults to to the upper bound.

Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.name: manualEntryOptionName
Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.abstract: Specifies the manual entry option name if isManualEntryCapable is set to true

Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.name: setIndexToManual()
Classes/PickerField.html#/s:14MaterialFi.abstract: Setter function to set the PickerField to its manaul entry row

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.name: init()
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.abstract: Required initializer if doing programtically. You can manually set the frame after initialization. Otherwise it relies on auto layout and its intrinsic content size.

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.name: resignFirstResponder()
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.abstract: Notifies the field that it has been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.name: becomeFirstResponder()
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.abstract: Opens the picker or the PickerField is on manual entry it will open the keyboard.

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.name: isFirstResponder
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.abstract: Asks to see if the field is the first responder. If it is on manual entry it asks the entryField if it is the responder otherwise it returns its isActive flag

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.name: canBecomeFirstResponder
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@M@MaterialF.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating wether the field can become the first responder by asking the entryField if it can become the first responder

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.name: pickerView(_:numberOfRowsInComponent:)
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.abstract: Returns data.count of string array passed in

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.name: pickerView(_:titleForRow:forComponent:)
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.abstract: Returns value in data[row] of string array passed in

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.name: entryFieldShouldBeginEditing(_:)
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.abstract: Opens picker or keyboard depending on picker index

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.name: entryFieldShouldReturn(_:)
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.abstract: Ends editing of entryField if isManualEntryCapable and is on manual entry

Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.name: entryFieldDidEndEditing(_:)
Classes/PickerField.html#/c:@CM@Material.abstract: closes picker if is on manual entry

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: text
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: The value in the text-based fields.

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: placeholder
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: This is the placeholder, or floating title of the field

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: isOptional
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Optional setter to append and (Optional) tag to the field’s placeholder

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: isActive
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Read only flag to check if the field is currently active

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: hasError
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Read only flag to check if the field is currently in a error state

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: shakes
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Dictates if a field should shake if it has an error

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: keyboardType
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Defines the type of keyboard that comes up when the field is active

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: autocapitalizationType
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Defines the auto capitilazation type of the text entered

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: autocorrectionType
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Defines the autocorrection used on the field

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: isSecureTextEntry
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Defines if the field needs secure text entry (passwords)

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: borderColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Border color

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: borderHighlightColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Border color when field is active

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: borderErrorColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Border color when there is an error in the field

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: textColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Normal text color

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: errorTextColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Error text color

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: placeholderDownColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Color of placeholder label when down

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: placeholderUpColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Color of placeholder label when up

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: cursorColor
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Color of cursor in field

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: setError(withText:)
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Error setter for text-based fields.

Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.name: removeErrorUI()
Classes/Field.html#/s:14MaterialFields5F.abstract: Clears error flag and UI from fields

Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.name: unit
Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.abstract: Optional unit label that shows up on the right hand side of the field

Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.name: isMonetary
Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.abstract: Optional setter to show a dollar sign on the left hand side of the field

Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.name: monetaryColor
Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.abstract: Color of the dollar sign if the field is monetary

Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.name: unitColor
Classes/EntryField.html#/s:14MaterialFie.abstract: Color of the unit label if the field has a unit label

Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.name: init()
Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.abstract: Required initializer if doing programtically. You can manually set the frame after initialization. Otherwise it relies on auto layout and its intrinsic content size.

Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.name: resignFirstResponder()
Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.abstract: Notifies the field that it has been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.

Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.name: becomeFirstResponder()
Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.abstract: Asks UIKit to make the field the first responder in its window.

Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.name: isFirstResponder
Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.abstract: Asks UIKit to make the EntryField is the first responder.

Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.name: canBecomeFirstResponder
Classes/EntryField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFi.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating wether the EntryField can become the first responder

Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.name: dateFormatter
Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.abstract: The dateFormatter you want to use to display the date in the field. Defaults to MMM dd, yyyy

Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.name: datePickerMode
Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.abstract: The date picker mode for the field.

Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.name: isClearable
Classes/DateField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.abstract: Setter for showing a clear button to eliminate the contents of the field.

Classes/DateField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: init()
Classes/DateField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Required initializer if doing programtically. You can manually set the frame after initialization. Otherwise it relies on auto layout and its intrinsic content size.

Classes/DateField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: resignFirstResponder()
Classes/DateField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Notifies the field that it has been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.

Classes/AreaField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.name: errorLabel
Classes/AreaField.html#/s:14MaterialFiel.abstract: The error label under the UITextField that appears on error being set

Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: init()
Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Required initializer if doing programtically. You can manually set the frame after initialization. Otherwise it relies on auto layout and it’s intrinsic content size.

Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: resignFirstResponder()
Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Notifies the field that it has been asked to relinquish its status as first responder in its window.

Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: becomeFirstResponder()
Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Asks UIKit to make the field the first responder in its window.

Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: isFirstResponder
Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Asks UIKit to make the EntryField is the first responder.

Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.name: canBecomeFirstResponder
Classes/AreaField.html#/c:@M@MaterialFie.abstract: Returns a boolean indicating wether the EntryField can become the first responder

Classes/EntryField.html.name: EntryField
Classes/EntryField.html.abstract: Material version of the UITextField (single line, for multiline capability use the AreaField class)

Classes/Field.html.name: Field
Classes/Field.html.abstract: Wrapper class for all fields. Makes data model validation and UI feedback a breeze.

Classes/PickerField.html.name: PickerField
Classes/PickerField.html.abstract: Material version of the UIPickerView (single column only, supports manual entry)
